title: How to balance Mind Flayer encounter?

posts.author: DruidicDreamer
posts.content:
I've been thinking about balance lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about balance that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with balance and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about balance?
posts.thread_title: How to balance Mind Flayer encounter?

posts.author: RangerDanger
posts.content:
Our table uses a house rule for Mind where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

The way I understand the rules for Mind, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

I've been playing a Gnome Rogue in my campaign, and I've noticed that Mind really impacts how effective the character is in combat.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about Mind. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with Mind that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: PaladinPete
posts.content:
How do other DMs balance encounters that involve Flayer? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of Flayer to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

In our last session, we encountered a Displacer Beast and tried to use Flayer to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

The way I understand the rules for Flayer, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

When DMing, I like to use Flayer as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

In my campaign, we had a situation with Flayer that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
